channel.title: CASP on Aditi Shenoy
channel.description: Recent content in CASP on Aditi Shenoy

item.title: CASP 15 Day-4
item.description: The assessment of predicted models is almost as important as the prediction itself. It would be hard to trust predictions if we don’t know how good they are when the native structure is not known.

item.title: CASP 15 Day-3
item.description: RNA structure The standard metric used for assessing the RNA structure (in terms of watson pairs, non-watson pairs and coaxial stacking) was RMSD.

item.title: CASP 15 Day-2
item.description: Overview talk 1 : Mapping machine learning to protein structure problems (John Jumper) The talk broadly covered 3 categories: Generative modelling (Diffusion models):

item.title: CASP 15 Day-1
item.description: Expanding criteria for review John Moult proposes a way to add evaluation criteria (e.g. reproducibility, robustness, training bias, suitability for benchmarking) for method-based and application-based papers.
